meanings.definition: To twist or contort the body in pain or struggle.
meanings.sent1: The injured man was writhing on the ground in agony.
meanings.sent2: The snake was writhing in the grass, trying to escape.
meanings.sent3: The writhing dance moves of the clown made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The branches of the tree were writhing in the wind like living creatures.
meanings.sent5: The image of the writhing octopus was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: To move in a twisting or contorted motion.
meanings.sent1: The river was writhing through the valley, creating a beautiful scene.
meanings.sent2: The dragon in the movie was writhing in its lair, ready to attack.
meanings.sent3: The writhing roller coaster made Sarah scream with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The shadows on the wall were writhing like ghostly figures.
meanings.sent5: The flames were writhing in the fireplace, casting a warm glow.
